p: The in vivo study published by Boroja et al. [ 14] revealed the ameliorating effects of methanolic extract of S. hortensis aerial part against cisplatin-induced oxidative damage in liver, kidney, and testes in rats, regulating levels of superoxide dismutase enzyme (SOD), catalase enzyme (CAT), glutathione (GSH) and thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS) affected by the administration of cisplatin.
